channel.title: Python

item.title: Python
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Kryptix:

[quote author=s1gma link=topic=547245.msg4012378#msg4012378 date=1339330511]why presume he’s learning it because it sounds cool? a lot of people suggest python as a beginners language because it’s easy to learn with a fairly anglicised syntax in comparison to most C-syntax languages, yet it has a rich ecosystem and a lot of resources for starting out with it. also, how the hell can he decide on a language to learn based on his usage case, when to be frank he probably doesn’t have one; he just wants to learn to program and therefore it will suffice. languages are tools and he wants a good tool for education.

I guess in my experience I’ve seen so many people attempt to learn Python because it sounds good. I’m just curious why he decided to learn that instead of a more popular language (such as Java, considering we’re on a RuneScape forum). In a lot of cases it’s almost like a dice throw.[/quote]
python is a very useful language…

Read full topic

item.title: Python
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

Kryptix:

[quote author=s1gma link=topic=547245.msg4012378#msg4012378 date=1339330511]why presume he’s learning it because it sounds cool? a lot of people suggest python as a beginners language because it’s easy to learn with a fairly anglicised syntax in comparison to most C-syntax languages, yet it has a rich ecosystem and a lot of resources for starting out with it. also, how the hell can he decide on a language to learn based on his usage case, when to be frank he probably doesn’t have one; he just wants to learn to program and therefore it will suffice. languages are tools and he wants a good tool for education.

I guess in my experience I’ve seen so many people attempt to learn Python because it sounds good. I’m just curious why he decided to learn that instead of a more popular language (such as Java, considering we’re on a RuneScape forum). In a lot of cases it’s almost like a dice throw.[/quote]Python’s actually quite popular. I hear Google uses it for their own scripting needs (of course all of the more CPU intensive stuff is done with C/C++).

You can do the same things with different languages and it’s all up to your personal preferences and influences.

Read full topic

item.title: Python
item.dc:creator: @Kryptix Kryptix
item.description:
@Kryptix wrote:

s1gma:

why presume he’s learning it because it sounds cool? a lot of people suggest python as a beginners language because it’s easy to learn with a fairly anglicised syntax in comparison to most C-syntax languages, yet it has a rich ecosystem and a lot of resources for starting out with it. also, how the hell can he decide on a language to learn based on his usage case, when to be frank he probably doesn’t have one; he just wants to learn to program and therefore it will suffice. languages are tools and he wants a good tool for education.

I guess in my experience I’ve seen so many people attempt to learn Python because it sounds good. I’m just curious why he decided to learn that instead of a more popular language (such as Java, considering we’re on a RuneScape forum). In a lot of cases it’s almost like a dice throw.

item.title: Python
item.dc:creator: @Xellium Xellium
item.description:
@Xellium wrote:

[quote=“Kryptix, post:3, topic:444560”]Terrible programming, I suggest watching a starter tutorial on YouTube. Also, don’t just try and learn Python because it sounds cool. Do you have any reason for using it over Java or C++? If not then I suggest researching the languages first and seeing if any of the pros will benefit your projects.

I’ve never learnt Python because I’ve never seen the point, it’s never been worth my time TBH.[/quote]

I know it’s terrible, I went to a website saw an example for while statements, and tried plugging it into something. Friends_Online was the first thing that came to my mind, there was no specific need for it. I just don’t like going straight by the tutorials. I like looping my own things into the tutorials, not so I can release, so that I can say at least I learned something if it works.

Read full topic

python is a great language if you don’t dip into TK.

item.title: Python
item.dc:creator: @classic mopmans little slave
item.description:
@classic wrote:

[quote=“Kryptix, post:3, topic:444560”]Terrible programming, I suggest watching a starter tutorial on YouTube. Also, don’t just try and learn Python because it sounds cool. Do you have any reason for using it over Java or C++? If not then I suggest researching the languages first and seeing if any of the pros will benefit your projects.

I’ve never learnt Python because I’ve never seen the point, it’s never been worth my time TBH.[/quote]
Python is an amazing and good language to start out with, you’re contradicting yourself. If you posted a code in java here I could be like “Are you trying to learn Java to sound cool? Python is a much easier language to start out with and it will help you in the future.”

Read full topic

item.description:
@Onix wrote:

[quote=“s1gma, post:4, topic:444560”][quote author=Kryptix link=topic=547245.msg4012178#msg4012178 date=1339308935]
Terrible programming, I suggest watching a starter tutorial on YouTube. Also, don’t just try and learn Python because it sounds cool. Do you have any reason for using it over Java or C++? If not then I suggest researching the languages first and seeing if any of the pros will benefit your projects.

I’ve never learnt Python because I’ve never seen the point, it’s never been worth my time TBH.
[/quote]why presume he’s learning it because it sounds cool? a lot of people suggest python as a beginners language because it’s easy to learn with a fairly anglicised syntax in comparison to most C-syntax languages, yet it has a rich ecosystem and a lot of resources for starting out with it. also, how the hell can he decide on a language to learn based on his usage case, when to be frank he probably doesn’t have one; he just wants to learn to program and therefore it will suffice. languages are tools and he wants a good tool for education.[/quote]Some schools and universities(colleges) also have python or other languages in their courses, so don’t just assume he is learning it because it sounds cool.

item.title: Python
item.dc:creator: @Xellium Xellium
item.description:
@Xellium wrote:

I get no errors, just nothing pops up in the idle.

[code=python]def FriendsOnlineOption():

Friends_Online = 1

while Friends_Online > 0:
    print('You have some friends online')
    while Friends_Online < 0:
        print('You cannot have less than 0 friends online, your chat is broken.')
        while Friends_Online == 0:
            print('You have no friends online, you sir are forever alone.')[/code]

Read full topic
